Posts.Title: Mets to Lung, Liver, Bones, and Brain thisgirl80 Analemma

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2009 07:06PM thisgirl80 wrote: Thank you all for the support.  I have posted on other boards and got little to no response and what I did get was cold as ice.  Thank you again.  It really helps to know that we are not alone out here.  I have another question to throw out.  My mom has recently had a personality shift, I guess that is what you would call it.  She seems different.  She doesn't want to take her pain meds even though it is clearly that she is in a great deal of pain.  I feel like she is hiding something from me.  I can't imagine what she is going through mentally, physically, or emotionally.  I just am scared, especially when she acts this way.  I want to help her but she doesn't seem to want to talk.  I asked her if she was ok and she says yes just doesn't feel good.  Oh, well.  All I can do is pray, pray, pray.  Thanks again ladies.  I know that God has sent me this way for a reason.  God Bless.
Posts.Title: Mets to Lung, Liver, Bones, and Brain thisgirl80 Analemma

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2009 07:35AM thisgirl80 wrote: She does have a Radiation Oncologist and a Neurologist.  But for now they are just doing the chemo.  Thank you for mentioning these things to me, I am going to inquire at her next appointment.  She has just gotten one shot of Depo-Cyte so far b/c she just started this treatment but they are going to do it every other week.  She was taken off the Methotrexate b/c of the side effects.  They were horrible.  I am afraid that they mets in her body is so aggressive that they are afraid to stop the chemo right now.  They are planning on rescanning everything in about 3 weeks.  I am ready to get those results, so we know where she is in this fight.  Dallasshan:  Thanks for responding to me.  It gives me strength to find someone with a similar story too.  Looking on all the boards I usually feel alone in my situation.  My mom will be 59 the end of April, everyone says she is fairly young.  I am 28 and an only child.  I have 2 small children so between my mom and my kids, they keep me hopping.  It is so good to feel like there is someone out there that shares my worries.  Any time you what to talk I have a ear. Thanks again ladies.  I want to cry every time I log on and find someone has responded to me.  The support that this board offers is incredible.  God bless.
Posts.Title: Mets to Lung, Liver, Bones, and Brain thisgirl80 Analemma

Posts.Content: thisgirl80 wrote: Hello, I have been lurking for a while and just found the courage to post here.  I don't know if I am allowed on this board since it is my mother that has the cancer and not me but I have gotten so much hope from this group of ladies already.  I really wanted your thoughts and advice on her situation.  My mother was diagnosed with BC in 2005.  She had her right breast removed and all her lymph nodes on that side taken out as well.  She went through chemo and radiation.  All was well until Spring 2007 when they found liver and bone mets.  She went through chemo again and seemed stable so they put her on Faslodex for "quality of life" reasons.  Seemed to be doing good from September to December.  The first week of January 2009 she was diagnosed with leptomeningeal spread and then lung mets. She is no longer able to drive. They have treated the brain mets for 8 weeks with methotrexate which caused her to be extremely sick.  They have switched her to Depo-Cyte, only one treatment into that one.  She is now on Gemzar and Navalbine for the liver, lung, and bones.  They are still having to adjust her dosage, her platelets count went from 175 to 65 in a week. Her short term memory is not doing so good.  Her anxiety level has went through the roof.  She gets so upset that it affects her breathing. She is on ativan already, had to up her dose recently.  I am just wondering if anyone else has had experience with all of these meds and mets.  I don't know what to expect.  I am scared and a bit numb by now.  I have found a lot of hope from this board and the things I have read.  It is nice to find some positive in all the negative out there.  Any thoughts or advice would be greatly appreciated.   Thank you all for sharing your stories and your stuggles and your trimphs.  Bless you all. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mets to Lung, Liver, Bones, and Brain thisgirl80 Analemma

Posts.Content: thisgirl80 wrote: I have been on here before asking questions about my mom and I have yet another.  She was diagnosed with stage IV last spring.  Her original dx was in 2005.  Spring 2007 it has spread to her liver and bones.  Jan 2009 they found it in her brain (dura mater) and her lungs.  She has had a multitude of other issues along the way.  Her port became infected recently and had to be removed.  They did a rescan last week and the results were good.  They showed no advancement in the lungs, brain, or bones.  The liver did have more lesions and the existing ones had grown but not significantly.  The dr seemed very pleased with the results and excited that things were as well as they were.  He seems to think that with consistent chemo things should start shrinking.  All seemed well. Mom felt good and we had just returned from a week at the beach, all was good.  Until, I called to ck on her the day after chemo and she was in A LOT of pain.  I went over to see her and she had a visible knot in her stomach and she said that is were most of the pain is located.  She was having to take pain meds, which she hasn't had to do in a while.  I am just worried since we got good news, nervous I guess.  Could this be a side effect from chemo? She is on navalbine and gemzar.  Nothing new to her.  I am just concerned.  She goes back for another treatment tomorrow.  My imagination is getting the best of me.  Oh well, I guess I just need to throw this out there.  Thanks.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Good news, and then.... thisgirl80 ccarter48818

Posts.Content: May 20, 2009 11:41PM thisgirl80 wrote: I am sorry to hear your story.  It sounds so familiar.  My mom was dx with breast cancer in 2005 and now with stage iv, liver and bones,  in 2008, this Jan they found it in her brain and lungs. What struck me about your story was that, like my mom, they originally thought the spot on her lungs was something else and then decided that it was cancer.  My mom's was thought to be infection but after her PA looked at the scans he determined that it was lung mets.  Scary that they miss things like that.  I pray that things get better for your mom and you.  God Bless.
Posts.Title: Question about my mom's symptoms - liver mets BestMomEver thisgirl80

Posts.Title: Genzar & Navalbine Side Effects thisgirl80 thisgirl80

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2009 12:15PM thisgirl80 wrote: Heidi, My sweet mother had this same diagnosis given to her in Jan 2009.  She had the methotrexate and it kicked her butt but it also got the cancer.  They switched her to Depocyte after she suffered neurotoxicity from the methotrexate.  The Depocyte was a breeze compared to the Methotrexate, as long as she took her steroids for the headaches.  Even with her last scans her  leptomeningeal spread was stable and the least of our worries.  I did all the googling when they gave her this diagnosis and it scared the crap out of me.  It isn't easy to find people to talk to.  My mother's test of her spinal fluid was neg. so that was a blessing but they still declared it cancer.  Her face was numb also and her legs didn't want to work.  Her short term memory seemed to go pretty bad with the  intrathecal chemo but they said that was normal and eased up after she quite chemo.  She had so many other things going on in her body though, I didn't realize were the real threat was and it wasn't the lepto.  I am sure you will have wonderful support from this great group of ladies.  And I am so glad you have CarynRose to give you advice and be a voice of experience.  I have learned that every situation is unique but talking to someone who has been there is always a help. You will be in my thoughts and prayers. You can PM me if you have any questions, I will try to help.
Posts.Title: Heidi Update-it isn't pretty Heidi_Ho zeeka71

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2009 05:19AM thisgirl80 wrote: Praise the Lord!!! Great news.  So happy to hear it.

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2009 02:16PM thisgirl80 wrote: My mom's platelets dropped after her first treatment and they had to skip a week and lower her dose.  They said that is a common side effect.  She also seems to get headaches but she also gets Depo-Cyte in her Omaya port, so we always blame the headache on that one.  Hope things go smooth for you.
